comments.message: But if both tastes the same, why do you still need to sell the one with sugar? 🙄
when will Coke Life available?
So it is coke zero with new wrapper?

Is this sugar free suitable for Diabtes
Do you use artificial sweetener for this?

As some people have said, why can't you just bring in Coke Life? I tried it at Mustafa and it tastes quite good, almost like normal Coke, yet contains 30% less sugar, which would be on par with a can of chrysanthemum tea. 

Also, it uses stevia, a natural sweetener, which is probably less harmful (or at least it sounds better) than aspartame. As a Coke fan, I'm willing to bet there are many people who continue to drink Coke rather than Coke Zero because they'd rather take their chances with sugar than with an artificial sweetener. That's sad.

comments.message: Congrats on being the lucky few to get the unique can! ;)

Hi Dee, thank you for your feedback.

Previously, many of our low and calorie products, including Coca-Cola zero (now Coca-Cola Zero Sugar) and Coca-Cola light, were not eligible for the Healthier Choice Symbol Program. These products and others became eligible after the Health Promotion Board revised the guidelines for all beverage products under its Healthier Choice Symbol Program with effect from 1 November 2015.

We know that some people enjoy the taste of our beverages but would like to reduce their sugar and calorie intake. That is why we offer a variety of great tasting beverages with reduced, low or no sugar and calories, including Coca-Cola zero sugar, Coca-Cola light and Sprite zero. 

We may be The Coca-Cola Company, but we realize everyone doesn’t drink soda. So we’re making many other drinks like teas (Heaven & Earth), coconut water (Zico), and waters (Dasani, glaceau smart water and glaceau vitaminwater) available to more people in more places.

We also recognize that clear and simple information can help people make healthy choices. We provide information on how many calories are in our beverages so people can choose what makes sense for them and their families. The adoption of the Healthier Choice logo on our lower-calorie and no-sugar drinks also encourages more people, including Coca-Cola Classic drinkers, to choose a no sugar option and reduce their sugar consumption.

Today, 40% of our portfolio comprises of either lower- or no-sugar and calorie options that quality for the Healthier Choice Symbol. Going forward, we will continue to listen carefully to our customers and consumers and give more Singaporeans the drinks they want and need.

Hope the above clarifies :) Wishing you a great evening ahead!
Thanks for your suggestion :)

Hi there, the increases in commodity prices have meant that there is the need for a price increase across our can SKUs. In order to ensure that we continue to provide affordable price points for people who love our drinks in Singapore, we have decided to reduce our sparkling brands (Coke, Coke light, Coke zero, Sprite, A&W, Fanta, Schweppes and Aquarius) from 330ml to 320ml and Heaven and Earth from 315ml to 300ml. This change brings our drinks in line with other canned beverages in the market.

While Coke Zero does not contain any calories, fat, carbohydrates, cholesterol or sugars, it also provides no nutritional benefits. The drink does not contain any protein, fiber, vitamin C, vitamin A, calcium or iron. This is particularly a concern for young people, who may substitute Coke Zero for a healthy beverages  which would provide them with much-needed calcium, vitamin D and protein.

Hi Shohel, this is a hoax and should not be trusted. We are aware of a number of emails and text messages in circulation claiming to be part of or affiliated with a Coca-Cola sponsored promotion or marketing programme, however The Coca-Cola Company is in no way associated with these. These scams are designed to extract personal information for the scammers' own financial gain. We strongly advise that you do not share any personal details, or make any payments to a given account. It would be best to also block the messages and delete them immediately.

21.post_text:
Want to win some awesome prizes including smartphones, tablets and Spotify premium accounts?

All you need to do is follow these 3 easy steps!
1) Get a bottle of Coca-Cola or our participating brands (with a yellow cap)
2) Look under the bottle cap for a unique 10-digit code
3) Enter your Code into CokeURL.com/OpenToWin OR send an SMS to 76677: COKE<space>Name<space>Code

What are you waiting for? Get a Coca-Cola now to WIN! Promotion ends 30th April. For T&Cs and more details visit: CokeURL.com/OpenToWin
#CocaColaSG
